alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 10:35AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Francis, southwestern Crittenden, southeastern Cross, western DeSoto and southwestern Shelby Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1035 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Home, or 8 miles southeast of Village Creek State Park, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Horn Lake, Hughes, Village Creek State Park, Memphis, Walls, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Widener, Anthonyville, Jennette, Lake Cormorant, Eudora, Simsboro, Whitehaven, Pinckney, Lynchburg, New Home, Trinity and Cottonwood Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
